isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC), Orifice Tube System, Pre-March 2007 - 3200, 4100, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500, 8600 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - AIR FILTER

caution.para: Never force the fresh/recirculate air door open. If the door position must be changed, follow the following procedures. Forcing the door will result in a broken door shaft and a costly repair.

step1.para: Remove the grille covering the HVAC air inlet (6, Figure 21), located in the cowl tray at the base of the windshield.
Verify that the fresh/recirculate air door is open. This can be done by looking into the cowl tray air inlet.
If the door is open proceed to the next step. If the door is closed, proceed as follows:

item.para: Turn the ignition key to the ON position (it's not necessary to start the engine),
Set the blower speed control on the HVAC control panel to OFF,
Turn the ignition key to the OFF position.

step1.para: Reaching into the HVAC air inlet, located in the evaporator housing (1), remove the air filter (2, Figure 22) by compressing the top of the filter, tipping it to the front, and lifting it straight up.

figure.caption: Figure 22. Cutaway View of Evaporator Housing (Recirculate Door Not Shown)

step1.para: With the filter pleats vertical, place the filter (2, Figure 22) into the evaporator housing (1) through the air inlet.

Position the bottom of the filter as far to the rear as possible (behind the positioning rib in the housing); then compress the top of the filter and push it to the rear until it is behind the top positioning ribs. The filter is in place when it is set behind the positioning ribs at all four corners.
Fit can be verified by grasping a central pleat and gently pulling forward. The filter should be retained by the ribs.
Install the grille covering the HVAC air inlet (6, Figure 21).
